title: Sezer Öztürk
text:
Sezer Öztürk (born 3 November 1985) is a Turkish former professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as an <a href="attacking%20midfielder">attacking midfielder</a> and <a href="central%20midfielder">central midfielder</a>. 
Club career.
Prior to 1996, Öztürk played for Türkgücü Velbert, <a href="SSVg%20Velbert">SSVg Velbert</a>, TVD Velbert and <a href="Rot-Weiss%20Essen">Rot-Weiss Essen</a>. From 1996 to 2005, he achieved seven league matches for <a href="Bayer%2004%20Leverkusen">Bayer 04 Leverkusen</a>, but only as substitute. In the 2005–06 season, Öztürk was loaned to the <a href="Belgian%20Cup">Belgian Cup</a> winners <a href="Germinal%20Beerschot">Germinal Beerschot</a> for one year in order to gather match practice. In January 2006, Öztürk moved to <a href="1.%20FC%20N%C3%BCrnberg">1. FC Nürnberg</a>.
In 2006, Öztürk joined <a href="Turkish%20S%C3%BCper%20Lig">Turkish Süper Lig</a> side <a href="Vestel%20Manisaspor">Vestel Manisaspor</a>. For the second half of the 2009–10 season, he moved for a fee of <a href="Turkish%20Lira">TRY</a> 1.6 million to <a href="Eski%C5%9Fehirspor">Eskişehirspor</a> and signed a contract until May 2012.
In 2011 summer transfer window, Öztürk joined then-defending champion <a href="Fenerbah%C3%A7e%20S.K.%20%28football%29">Fenerbahçe</a> on a four-year contract for <a href="Euro">€</a>3.75 million.
Öztürk joined <a href="Be%C5%9Fikta%C5%9F%20J.K.">Beşiktaş</a> in 2013 summer transfer window with €1.5 million transfer fee, but never made a professional debut there. In <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20S%C3%BCper%20Lig">2014–15 season</a>, he was loaned out <a href="%C4%B0stanbul%20Ba%C5%9Fak%C5%9Fehir%20F.K.">İstanbul Başakşehir</a>. He was dropped out of squad and requested to find a club in 2015 and he was reportedly spotted as he was performing amateur boxing trainings and had gained weight.
International career.
Öztürk was runner-up in the European Championship with the U-19 national team of Turkey. In 2010, he was called up to the <a href="Turkey%20national%20football%20team">Turkey national team</a> under new coach <a href="Guus%20Hiddink">Guus Hiddink</a>, for preparation in the U.S., but did not earn any caps.
Murder incident.
On 19 September 2021, Öztürk allegedly killed one and injured four with his gun in a traffic dispute in <a href="%C5%9Eile">Şile</a>, Turkey. He and a friend were attempting to cross a path that was blocked by bystanders. An argument followed and became a fight wherein Öztürk pulled out a gun and shot the bystanders, before fleeing the scene. The scene was captured by cell-phone cameras and security camera, but he remained at large as of 27 September 2021 with an arrest warrant for charges of "deliberate killing" and "deliberate injury".
Honours.
Manisaspor
Fenerbahçe
